describe: Chad is a landlocked country in north-central Africa. It is bordered by Libya to the north, Sudan to the east, the Central African Republic to the south, Cameroon and Nigeria to the southwest, and Niger to the west. Chad is known for its diverse cultures, languages, and landscapes, ranging from the Sahara Desert in the north to the fertile savannas in the south.

cities.geographical_location: Located in the southwestern part of Chad, near the border with Cameroon.
cities.climate: N'Djamena has a hot semi-arid climate with a wet season from June to September and a dry season from October to May.
cities.famous_cuisine: Famous local dishes include Jarret de Boeuf (beef stew) and La Boule (millet porridge).
